content.user_title: Create product marketing strategies with battlecards
content.value_statement: Product marketing teams struggle to develop positioning, GTM strategies, and competitive battlecards without structured frameworks. This skill provides April Dunford positioning methodology, launch playbooks, international market entry guides, and battlecard templates to accelerate go-to-market execution.
actual_capabilities: Define ICP and buyer personas using firmographics, technographics, and psychographics frameworks
Apply April Dunford positioning methodology to create differentiated value propositions
Build competitive battlecards with objection handling and proof points for each competitor
Plan go-to-market strategies for PLG, sales-led, or hybrid motion with budget allocation
Develop 90-day launch playbooks with pre-launch, launch, and post-launch activities
Create international market entry strategies for US, UK, DACH, France, and Canada
limitations: Does not execute marketing campaigns or automatically update CRM systems
Does not provide real-time competitive intelligence or pricing monitoring
Requires manual input of company-specific data for templates to be effective
Does not integrate directly with HubSpot, Gong, or other sales tools

use_cases.title: Develop positioning strategy
use_cases.description: Create differentiated positioning using the April Dunford framework with unique attributes mapped to customer value.

use_cases.title: Build competitive battlecards
use_cases.description: Generate battlecards with talk tracks, proof points, and win/loss scenarios for each competitor.

use_cases.title: Plan international expansion
use_cases.description: Develop phased market entry strategies for EU and Canada with localization and compliance requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Define ICP
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me define the ideal customer profile for our B2B SaaS product using firmographics, technographics, and psychographics. Current stage: Series A, target market: Mid-market companies.

prompt_templates.title: Position against competitors
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the April Dunford positioning methodology to differentiate our product against Competitor A and Competitor B. Our key differentiators are: [list your differentiators]

prompt_templates.title: Create battlecard
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a competitive battlecard for [Competitor Name]. They are positioned as [their positioning]. We compete on: [your advantages]. Include talk tracks for objection handling.

prompt_templates.title: Plan market entry
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop a go-to-market strategy for entering [Country/Region] market. Include localization requirements, budget allocation, timeline, and success metrics for first 12 months.

output_examples.input: Create positioning for our AI-powered project management tool targeting mid-market SaaS companies
output: Positioning Statement: [Product] helps [mid-market SaaS teams] [ship products 2x faster] by [automating project workflows with AI]
Unique Attributes: AI automation, real-time collaboration, integration with developer tools
Best-Fit Customers: Series B SaaS companies with 100-500 employees, distributed teams
Category Decision: Compete in existing 'project management' category but own 'AI-powered project management' subcategory

output_examples.input: Build a battlecard for our main competitor who has more features but higher pricing
output: Competitor Overview: Established player with $100M+ ARR, feature-rich but complex
Their Strengths: Brand recognition, extensive integrations, enterprise customer base
Their Weaknesses: Steep learning curve, expensive for mid-market, slow support response
Talk Track: Most teams only use 20% of features. Our customers love focused simplicity.
When to Win: Budget-conscious teams, fast time-to-value priority, switching from competitor experience

output_examples.input: Plan UK market entry for our B2B SaaS product
output: Budget: 20% of marketing spend ($80k first year)
Key Actions: Hire UK sales rep, localize pricing to GBP, ensure GDPR compliance
Success Metrics: 10 UK customers, Â£25k average deal size, <90 day sales cycle

best_practices: Validate ICP with at least 5 paying customers matching your profile before scaling acquisition
Update competitive battlecards monthly or when competitors launch major features
Test messaging with sales team and prospects before launching campaigns
anti_patterns: Defining ICP too broadly - focus on specific segment before expanding
Creating battlecards without win/loss data to back up claims
Skipping qualitative customer interviews before quantitative A/B testing

faq.question: What funding stage is this skill optimized for?
faq.answer: Series A+ startups expanding internationally with hybrid PLG/sales-led motion.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with HubSpot or Salesforce?
faq.answer: The skill provides frameworks and templates but does not directly integrate with CRM systems.

faq.question: How do I create my first positioning statement?
faq.answer: Use the April Dunford 6-step framework: list alternatives, isolate unique attributes, map to value, define best-fit customers, nail your category, layer on trends.

faq.question: How often should I update battlecards?
faq.answer: Update battlecards monthly or when competitors launch major features, announce pricing changes, or shift positioning.

faq.question: What markets are covered in international expansion?
faq.answer: US, UK, DACH (Germany/Austria/Switzerland), France, and Canada with localization and compliance guidance.

faq.question: Does this skill help with sales enablement?
faq.answer: Yes, includes sales deck templates, one-pagers, demo scripts, objection handling guides, and training program outlines.
